snippet: Cory A. Booker, long a national political celebrity despite never even holding a statewide office, seems poised to get a spot to match his much-discussed promise.
abstract: Newark Mayor Cory A Booker seems poised to step into a position that matches his much-discussed political promise as he enters race for United States Senate seat left vacant by the death of Sen Frank R Lautenberg; Booker is heavy favorite, with 40-point advantage in early polls.
lead_paragraph: Cory A. Booker, long a national political celebrity despite never even holding a statewide office, seems poised to get a spot to match his much-discussed promise.

headline.main: Booker, in Senate Race, Will Try to Match His Reputation
headline.print_headline: For Booker, the Sprint to Match His Reputation Begins
